answerText: Krebs Cycle[10] The matrix of the mitochondrion is surrounded by a heavily folded inner membrane. Those folds and the compartments they form are given this name
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 1 | 9 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This biochemical pathway produces one molecule of GTP through the action of succinate dehydrogenase, and this pathway is immediately upstream of the electron transport chain. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this biochemical cycle which takes place within the matrix of the mitochondrion, named for a German.
